meanings.definition: Not bright in color or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sky was very unbright on that cloudy day.
meanings.sent2: The room was unbright because the curtains were closed.
meanings.sent3: The unbright paint color made the house look gloomy.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as unbright as the overcast sky.
meanings.sent5: The unbright flowers in the garden failed to attract butterflies.

meanings.definition: Lacking intelligence or quickness of mind.
meanings.sent1: The unbright student struggled to understand the math problem.
meanings.sent2: His unbright response to the question surprised the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The unbright decision to wear mismatched socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her unbright idea to use a fork as a hairbrush was quickly dismissed.
meanings.sent5: The unbright squirrel kept trying to climb the slippery pole.
